main.name: Joshua Chua
main.description: Currently a third year student at the University of Toronto, I am looking for ways to develop impactful software and incite meaningful change.
main.bio: Hey there! I made this website for you to get to know me better, so feel free to browse my work experiences and projects. One thing I will say is that I am someone who is always looking for opportunities to create new things - whether that be in software, business or even photography!
main.contactmessage: Want to get in contact with me? Shoot me a message below!

resume.skillmessage: As someone who enjoys working on projects with others, I recognize the importance of having both technical ability and interpersonal skills. Below is a summary of a few key skills that make me suitable to contribute on any team:

education.description: As a student at the University of Toronto, I am very fortunate to be studying something that I am passionate about. Through my first few years, I have taken courses such as: Data Structures and Analysis, Algorithm Design, Intro to Software Engineering, Software Design (Java), Software Tools and Systems Programming (C), Statistical Reasoning and Data Science, Theory of Computation, Mathematical Expression and Reasoning for CS.
education.extracurriculars: In addition to my academics, I have taken various leadership roles on campus and enjoy the opportunities to collaborate with others, whether it be as a UofT Department of Computer Science Ambassador or UofTHacks Logistic Executive. I also enjoy connecting with others in the form of mentorship, and get the opportunity to do so as an an E-Mentor for incoming Woodsworth College students.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Throughout my second term at Teranet, I developed various web services to increase data output and user security. I also led the UI mobile optimization effort, improving user experience on phone screens and tablets. As well, I designed two new Property Insights reports through JasperReports, and integrated them with our Java Spring backend.

work.title: Mobile Software Developer
work.description: Spearheaded the exciting development of Dose, a mobile app designed to help patients better keep track of their medications. Leveraging the cross-platform functionality of Nativescript, I implemented various RESTful APIs and an intuitive user interface to produce a prototype that will be presented to doctors.

work.company: University of Toronto - Daniels Faculty of Architecture
work.title: Research Assistant (Mobile Dev)
work.description: In collaboration with the MIT Urban Risk Lab and the Daniels Faculty of Architecture at UofT, I worked on the development of Flux.Land - a geospatial platform that will be used to assess risk factors and data trends in Broward County. One of my key contributions has been increasing the efficiency of backend asset retrieval through ExpressJS!

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Full-stack development in an Agile Scrum environment, using a wide range of technologies such as AngularJS, Java Spring JPA, SQL, and HTML/CSS/LESS. Worked in tandem with product owners to improve key functionalities that are used by 85,000+ users.

projects.title: B2Z - Boomer2Zoomer
projects.category: A platform to connect the younger generations with great mentors!

projects.title: Dose
projects.category: An app to help patients correctly log their medication usage.

projects.title: Fluxland
projects.category: Innovative geo-spatial platform to address the risk factors of Broward County.

projects.title: Geowarehouse
projects.category: Used by real estate boards across Ontario. This is what I've worked on during my internships!

projects.title: ATM Machine
projects.category: Need more cash? This Java program has you covered.

projects.title: Autocompleter Engine
projects.category: Because what else would data structures and python be used for?

projects.title: Announcements App
projects.category: A mobile solution to a school's unsatisfactory PA system.

testimonials.text: Joshua is a professional and reliable front end developer. He handles his assignments promptly, and delivers them with efficiency. He is an amazing team member, and can be trusted to work independently as well. He has proven to be extremely resourceful and innovative with technical issues, and it’s clear that he is well versed in various front end development frameworks. Joshua maintains high standards for his work and can be observed to be striving for excellence in each of his endeavours. Joshua will be a great asset for any team he joins.

Joshua has been working as a co-op developer in my team, and I really enjoyed working with him. He was a fast learner and demonstrated strong responsibilities with his tasks.  Everyone in the team liked working with Joshua and he earned trust from his team members in a short time.
